description:
Currently the hung reboots periodic tasks queries for *all* instances in the database. It really should only querying for instances belonging to it's own host.

This should use the `instance_get_all_by_host(context, self.host)` pattern used elsewhere.
title: Hung reboots periodic task should only act on it's own instances

comments.content:
Currently the hung reboots periodic tasks queries for *all* instances in the database. It really should only querying for instances belonging to it's own host.

This should use the `instance_get_all_by_host(context, self.host)` pattern used elsewhere.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rconradharris

comments.content:
The bug is not exist anymore.

New codes of '_poll_rebooting_instances()' has already fixed it:

        if CONF.reboot_timeout > 0:
            filters = {'task_state': task_states.REBOOTING,
                       'host': self.host}
            rebooting = instance_obj.InstanceList.get_by_filters(
                context, filters, expected_attrs=[])

So, we could close this bug now~~
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wingwj
